summary: This is an email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York providing off-the-record guidance to media regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. It details the maximum penalties she faces for each count and notes the court's ruling allowing certain witnesses to testify under pseudonyms to protect alleged victims' identities.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant facing trial on six counts related to sex trafficking and transporting minors for illegal sex acts.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Issued a trial logistics order attached to this correspondence.

events.title: Media Guidance Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends off-the-record guidance to media regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, including witness anonymity and potential penalties.

keyFacts: The court ruled that several government witnesses who are not alleged victims may testify under pseudonyms to protect the identities of alleged victims.
Ghislaine Maxwell faced six counts including conspiracy to commit sex trafficking of minors (max 40 years) and sex trafficking of minors (max 5 years).
The document is media guidance from the U.S. Attorney's Office urging respect for witness privacy and adherence to policies against identifying sex crime victims.
A trial logistics order from Judge Nathan was attached to this correspondence.
